TopicTitle: What will be the next space event to get live TV coverage?

Articles.Content:
As many of you know, public interest is not very high for spaceflight right now. But I feel like it is gradually ramping up, and I was wondering, what will be the next space event to get live TV coverage on a major news channel? And not just get some discussion, like the interviews with the Mars One candidates, but actual live footage, like back in the 60s.

I think it will be the first Commercial Crew launch (with crew).
New Horizons closest pass. So, check again in 4 weeks?
Other then New Horizons, when SLS gets its first launch the news will be all over it.
Tiangong 2, given that's pretty standard for major Chinese launches.

Pedophile Escapes on Mars One, rocket ordered to turn around.

Mars Crew Member Moons the Earth, exclusive video footage revealed.

Mars Crew Turns Cannibal as Food Supplies run low, dead bodies being used as fertilizer.

While you can get "live news coverage" any day of the week for a few seconds, to become the real media hotspot you need some kind of disgusting twist. It's called the Entertainment Media for a reason, you know ;p

(Do note: I'm just talking about the state of society as it is, the news is populated with items more for their shock value than for their actual importance to society.)
